skim.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to remove something from the surface of a liquid, especially floating fat, solids, or oil
skim.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: After simmering the meat, skim the fat from the surface.
skim.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to read something quickly to find the main facts or ideas in it
skim.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Just skim through the second section to save time.
skim.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to move along quickly over a surface, never touching it or not touching it often
skim.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The ball skimmed across the grass and stopped against the wall.
skim.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to secretly record the details of someone’s credit card  electronically in order            to use them illegally
skim.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to take money illegally, for example by not saying that you have made profits so that you do not have to pay tax
skim.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He was accused of skimming profits from junk bond trading.
Corrupt profiteers have skimmed off much of the nation’s vast mineral wealth over the past decades.
